bioprojects.title: The Drosophila melanogaster genome was assembled from a combination of whole genome shotgun (WGS) and clone-based sequence data, and is annotated by the FlyBase Consortium.

attributes.name: genotype
attributes.value: y[1]; Gr22b[1] Gr22d[1] cn[1] CG33964[R4.2] bw[1] sp[1]; LysC[1] MstProx[1] GstD5[1] Rh6[1]

description.comment: isogenic strain used for sequencing of the reference genome by BDGP and Celera Genomics, as described in Adams et al 2000 (PMID: 10731132)
description.title: iso-1

assemblyInfo.comments:
This sequence is a scaffold of ordered and oriented sequence contigs from a whole genome shotgun assembly (WGS3). Gaps in the sequence are filled with Ns to the estimated size.
For further information about this sequence, including its location and relationship to other sequences, please visit our sequence archive Web site (http://www.fruitfly.org) or send email to bdgp@fruitfly.berkeley.edu.
The number of contigs is less than the number of accession numbers because some contigs have been replaced by others.
The CON records are the annotated heterochomatin from the FlyBase Consortium (GPID 13812). CM000456-CM000461 are from the chromosome arms, and DS483543-DS486008 are the unplaced (chrUn) sequences. FA000001 is the unordered assembly of those unplaced sequences.
assemblyInfo.submitter: The FlyBase Consortium/Berkeley Drosophila Genome Project/Celera Genomics
